intro: Polystachya guerzorum, commonly known as the Guerzón spike orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its tall, erect stem and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are elongated and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Polystachya guerzorum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
